36 # Image Processing
37 def improve_mask(mask):
38  """
39  Improve binary mask with morphological operation
40 
41  :param mask: input mask to improve
42  :type mask: numpy.array
43  :return mask: mask improved
44  :rtype mask: numpy.array
45  """
46 
47  kernel = np.ones((3, 3))
48  mask = cv2.erode(mask, kernel)
49  mask = cv2.erode(mask, kernel)
50  mask = cv2.dilate(mask, kernel)
51  mask = cv2.dilate(mask, kernel)
52  return mask
53 
54 
55 def threshold_red(img_hsv):
56  """
57  Threshold hsv image of red component
58  :param img_hsv: hsv image to be threshold
59  :type img_hsv: numpy.array
60  :param red_img: threshold img
61  :rtype: numpy.array
62  """
63  RED_L = [0, 85, 120], [35, 255, 255]
64  RED_H = [150, 100, 80], [180, 255, 255]
65  red_low_img = cv2.inRange(img_hsv, tuple(RED_L[0]), tuple(RED_L[1]))
66  red_high_img = cv2.inRange(img_hsv, tuple(RED_H[0]), tuple(RED_H[1]))
67  red_img = cv2.bitwise_or(red_low_img, red_high_img)
68  red_img = improve_mask(red_img)
69  return red_img
70 
71 
72 def threshold_green(img_hsv):
73  """
74  Threshold hsv image of green component
75  :param img_hsv: hsv image to be threshold
76  :type img_hsv: numpy.array
77  :param green_img: threshold img
78  :rtype: numpy.array
79  """
80  GREEN = [60, 30, 60], [95, 255, 255]
81  green_img = cv2.inRange(img_hsv, tuple(GREEN[0]), tuple(GREEN[1]))
82  green_img = improve_mask(green_img)
83  return green_img
84 
85 
86 def threshold_blue(img_hsv):
87  """
88  Threshold hsv image of blue component
89  :param img_hsv: hsv image to be threshold
90  :type img_hsv: numpy.array
91  :param blue_img: threshold img
92  :rtype: numpy.array
93  """
94  BLUE = [100, 50, 100], [125, 255, 255]
95  blue_img = cv2.inRange(img_hsv, tuple(BLUE[0]), tuple(BLUE[1]))
96  blue_img = improve_mask(blue_img)
97  return blue_img
98 
99 
100 def threshold_hsv(img, color_hsv):
101  """
102  Take BGR image (OpenCV imread result) and return thresholded image
103  according to values on HSV (Hue, Saturation, Value)
104  Pixel will worth 1 if a pixel has a value between min_v and max_v for all channels
105 
106  :param img: image BGR if rgb_space = False
107  :type img: numpy.array
108  :return: threshold image
109  :rtype: numpy.array
110  """
111  frame = cv2.GaussianBlur(img, (5, 5), 0)
112  frame_hsv = cv2.cvtColor(frame, cv2.COLOR_BGR2HSV)
113 
114  # red threshold
115  if color_hsv.value == 1:
116  thresh_img = threshold_red(frame_hsv)
117  # green threshold
118  elif color_hsv.value == 2:
119  thresh_img = threshold_green(frame_hsv)
120  # blue threshold
121  elif color_hsv.value == 3:
122  thresh_img = threshold_blue(frame_hsv)
123  # any
124  else:
125  thresh_red = threshold_red(frame_hsv)
126  thresh_green = threshold_green(frame_hsv)
127  thresh_blue = threshold_blue(frame_hsv)
128 
129  thresh_img = cv2.bitwise_or(thresh_red, thresh_green)
130  thresh_img = cv2.bitwise_or(thresh_img, thresh_blue)
131 
132  return thresh_img
133 
134 
135 def morphological_transformations(im_thresh,
136  morpho_type=MorphoType.CLOSE,
137  kernel_shape=(5, 5),
138  kernel_type=KernelType.ELLIPSE):
139  """
140  Take black & white image and apply morphological transformation
141 
142  :param im_thresh: Black & White Image
143  :type im_thresh: numpy.array
144  :param morpho_type: CLOSE/OPEN/ERODE/DILATE => See on OpenCV/Google if you do not know these words
145  :type morpho_type: MorphoType
146  :param kernel_shape: tuple corresponding to the size of the kernel
147  :type kernel_shape: tuple[float]
148  :param kernel_type: RECT/ELLIPSE/CROSS => see on OpenCV
149  :type kernel_type: KernelType
150  :return: image after processing
151  :rtype: numpy.array
152  """
153  if not isinstance(morpho_type, MorphoType) or not isinstance(kernel_type, KernelType):
154  raise TypeError
155 
156  kernel = cv2.getStructuringElement(kernel_type.value, kernel_shape)
157 
158  return cv2.morphologyEx(im_thresh, morpho_type.value, kernel)

161 # Contours
162 def get_contour_barycenter(contour):
163  """
164  Return barycenter of an OpenCV Contour
165 
166  :param contour:
167  :type contour: OpenCV Contour
168  :return: Barycenter X, Barycenter Y
169  :rtype: int, int
170  """
171  moments = cv2.moments(contour)
172  if moments['m00'] == 0:
173  rect = cv2.boundingRect(contour)
174  cx, cy, _, _ = rect
175  else:
176  cx = int(moments['m10'] / moments['m00'])
177  cy = int(moments['m01'] / moments['m00'])
178 
179  return cx, cy
180 
181 
182 def get_contour_angle(contour):
183  """
184  Return orientation of a contour according to the smallest side
185  in order to be well oriented for gripper
186 
187  :param contour: contour
188  :type contour: OpenCV Contour
189  :return: Angle in radians
190  :rtype: float
191  """
192  rotrect = cv2.minAreaRect(contour)
193  angle = rotrect[-1]
194  size1, size2 = rotrect[1][0], rotrect[1][1]
195  ratio_size = float(size1) / float(size2)
196  if 1.25 > ratio_size > 0.75:
197  if angle < -45:
198  angle = 90 + angle
199  else:
200  if size1 < size2:
201  angle = angle + 180
202  else:
203  angle = angle + 90
204 
205  if angle > 90:
206  angle = angle - 180
207 
208  return math.radians(angle)
209

211 def biggest_contour_finder(img):
212  res = biggest_contours_finder(img, nb_contours_max=1)
213  if not res:
214  return res
215  else:
216  return res[0]
217 
218 
219 def biggest_contours_finder(img, nb_contours_max=3):
220  """
221  Function to find the biggest contour in an binary image
222 
223  :param img: Binary Image
224  :type img: numpy.array
225  :param nb_contours_max: maximal number of contours which will be returned
226  :type nb_contours_max: int
227  :return: biggest contours found
228  :rtype: list[OpenCV Contour]
229  """
230  contours = cv2.findContours(img, cv2.RETR_LIST, cv2.CHAIN_APPROX_NONE)[-2]
231  if not contours:
232  return None
233  contours_area = list()
234  for cnt in contours:
235  contours_area.append(cv2.contourArea(cnt))
236  biggest_contours = []
237  le = len(contours_area)
238  if nb_contours_max > le:
239  nb_contours = le
240  id_contours_sorted_init = list(range(nb_contours))
241  else:
242  nb_contours = nb_contours_max
243  id_contours_sorted_init = np.argpartition(contours_area, -nb_contours)[-nb_contours:]
244  id_contours_sorted = [x for x in sorted(id_contours_sorted_init, key=lambda idi: -contours_area[idi])]
245 
246  for i in range(nb_contours):
247  id_used = id_contours_sorted[i]
248 
249  if contours_area[id_used] < 400:
250  break
251 
252  biggest_contours.append(contours[id_used])
253  return biggest_contours
254 
255 
256 def draw_contours(img, contours):
257  """
258  Draw a list of contour on an image and return the drawing image
259 
260  :param img: Image
261  :type img: numpy.array
262  :param contours: contours list
263  :type contours: list[OpenCV Contour]
264  :return: Image with drawing
265  :rtype: numpy.array
266  """
267  if len(img.shape) == 2:
268  img_bgr = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_GRAY2BGR)
269  else:
270  img_bgr = img.copy()
271  cv2.drawContours(img_bgr, contours, -1, (255, 0, 0), 3)
272  return img_bgr

275 def extract_img_workspace(img, workspace_ratio=1.0):
276  """
277  Extract working area from an image thanks to 4 Niryo's markers
278 
279  :param img: OpenCV image which contain 4 Niryo's markers
280  :type img: numpy.array
281  :param workspace_ratio: Ratio between the width and the height of the area represented by the markers
282  :type workspace_ratio: float
283  :return: extracted and warped working area image
284  :rtype: numpy.array
285  """
286  return extract_img_markers(img, workspace_ratio)

289 def relative_pos_from_pixels(img, x_pixels, y_pixels):
290  """
291  Transform a pixels position to a relative position
292 
293  :param img: Image where the object is detected
294  :type img: numpy.array
295  :param x_pixels: coordinate X
296  :type x_pixels: int
297  :param y_pixels: coordinate Y
298  :type y_pixels: int
299  :return: X relative, Y relative
300  :rtype: float, float
301  """
302  return float(x_pixels) / img.shape[1], float(y_pixels) / img.shape[0]

309 def show_and_check_close(window_name, img):
310  """
311  Display an image and check whether the user want to close
312 
313  :param window_name: window's name
314  :type window_name: str
315  :param img: Image
316  :type img: numpy.array
317  :return: boolean indicating if the user wanted to leave
318  :rtype: bool
319  """
320  cv2.imshow(window_name, img)
321  return cv2.waitKey(1) in keys_leave

324 def show_img(window_name, img, wait_ms=1):
325  """
326  Display an image during a certain time
327 
328  :param window_name: window's name
329  :type window_name: str
330  :param img: Image
331  :type img: numpy.array
332  :param wait_ms: Wait time in milliseconds
333  :type wait_ms: int
334  :return: value of the key pressed during the display
335  :rtype: int
336  """
337  if type(wait_ms) == float:
338  wait_ms = int(wait_ms)
339  if wait_ms < 1:
340  wait_ms = 1
341  cv2.imshow(window_name, img)
342  return cv2.waitKey(wait_ms)

345 def show_and_wait_close(window_name, img):
346  """
347  Display an image and wait that the user close it
348 
349  :param window_name: window's name
350  :type window_name: str
351  :param img: Image
352  :type img: numpy.array
353  :return: None
354  :rtype: None
355  """
356  cv2.imshow(window_name, img)
357  cv2.waitKey(0)

360 # -- IMAGE EDITING
361 def compress_image(img, quality=90):
362  """
363  Compress OpenCV image
364 
365  :param img: OpenCV Image
366  :type img: numpy.array
367  :param quality: integer between 1 - 100. The higher it is, the less information will be lost,
368  but the heavier the compressed image will be
369  :type quality: int
370  :return: status & string representing compressed image
371  :rtype: bool, str
372  """
373  result, encimg = cv2.imencode('.jpg', img, [int(cv2.IMWRITE_JPEG_QUALITY), quality])
374  if not result:
375  return False, None
376 
377  return True, np.array(encimg).tostring()
378 
379 
380 def uncompress_image(compressed_image):
381  """
382  Take a compressed img and return an OpenCV image
383 
384  :param compressed_image: compressed image
385  :type compressed_image: str
386  :return: OpenCV image
387  :rtype: numpy.array
388  """
389  np_arr = np.fromstring(compressed_image, np.uint8)
390  return cv2.imdecode(np_arr, cv2.IMREAD_COLOR)

393 def add_annotation_to_image(img, text, write_on_top=True):
394  """
395  Add Annotation to an image
396 
397  :param img: Image
398  :type img: numpy.array
399  :param text: text string
400  :type text: str
401  :param write_on_top: if you write the text on top
402  :type write_on_top: bool
403  :return: img with text written on it
404  :rtype: numpy.array
405  """
406  font_scale_used = font_scale_normal
407  thickness_used = thickness_small
408  h_im, w_im = img.shape[:2]
409  (text_width, text_height), baseline = cv2.getTextSize(text, font, fontScale=font_scale_used,
410  thickness=thickness_used)
411  text_true_height = text_height + baseline
412  if write_on_top:
413  cv2.rectangle(img, (0, 0), (int(text_width * 1.1), int(text_true_height * 1.35)), WHITE, cv2.FILLED)
414  cv2.putText(img,
415  text, (int(text_width * 0.05), int(text_true_height * 1.2 - baseline)),
416  font,
417  font_scale_used,
418  ORANGE,
419  thickness_used)
420  else:
421  cv2.rectangle(img, (int(text_width * 1.1), h_im - int(text_true_height * 1.35)), (0, h_im), WHITE, cv2.FILLED)
422  cv2.putText(img, text, (int(text_width * 0.05), h_im - baseline), font, font_scale_used, ORANGE, thickness_used)
423  return img

426 def undistort_image(img, mtx, dist):
427  """
428  Use camera intrinsics to undistort raw image
429 
430  :param img: Raw Image
431  :type img: numpy.array
432  :param mtx: Camera Intrinsics matrix
433  :type mtx: list[list[float]]
434  :param dist: Distortion Coefficient
435  :type dist: list[list[float]]
436  :return: Undistorted image
437  :rtype: numpy.array
438  """
439  return cv2.undistort(src=img, cameraMatrix=mtx, distCoeffs=dist)

441 
442 def resize_img(img, width=None, height=None, inter=cv2.INTER_AREA):
443  """
444  Resize an image. The user should precise only width or height if he wants to keep image's ratio
445 
446  :param img: OpenCV Image
447  :type img: numpy.array
448  :param width: Target Width
449  :type width: int
450  :param height: Target Height
451  :type height: int
452  :param inter: OpenCV interpolation flag
453  :type inter: long
454  :return: resized image
455  :rtype: numpy.array
456  """
457  if width is None and height is None:
458  return img
459 
460  height_init, width_init = img.shape[:2]
461 
462  if width is None:
463  ratio = height / float(height_init)
464  dim = (int(width_init * ratio), height)
465 
466  elif height is None:
467  ratio = width / float(width_init)
468  dim = (width, int(height_init * ratio))
469  else:
470  dim = (width, height)
471 
472  resized = cv2.resize(img, dim, interpolation=inter)
473 
474  return resized
475 
476 
477 def concat_imgs(tuple_imgs, axis=1):
478  """
479  Concat multiple images along 1 axis
480 
481  :param tuple_imgs: tuple of images
482  :type tuple_imgs: tuple[numpy.array]
483  :param axis: 0 means vertically and 1 means horizontally
484  :type axis: int
485  :return: Concat image
486  :rtype: numpy.array
487  """
488  new_list_imgs = []
489  for image in tuple_imgs:
490  if len(image.shape) == 2:
491  image = cv2.cvtColor(image, cv2.COLOR_GRAY2BGR)
492  new_list_imgs.append(image)
493 
494  concat_im = np.concatenate(tuple(new_list_imgs), axis=axis)
495  return concat_im

500 
501 def extract_img_from_ros_msg(ros_msg):
502  """
503  Take a ROS CompressedImage message and return the image uncompressed
504 
505  :param ros_msg: a ROS CompressedImage
506  :type ros_msg: :sensor_msgs:`CompressedImage`
507  :return: image uncompressed
508  :rtype: numpy.array
509  """
510  data_image = ros_msg.data
511  if not data_image:
512  return None
513  image = uncompress_image(data_image)
514  return image

519 
520 def debug_threshold_color(img, color_hsv):
521  """
522  Return masked image to see the effect of color threshold
523 
524  :param img: OpenCV image
525  :type img: numpy.array
526  :param color_hsv: Color used for debug
527  :type color_hsv: ColorHSV
528  :return: Masked image
529  :rtype: numpy.array
530  """
531  thresh_img = threshold_hsv(img, color_hsv)
532  im_morph = morphological_transformations(thresh_img, MorphoType.OPEN, kernel_shape=(7, 7))
533  return cv2.bitwise_and(img, img, mask=im_morph)
534
